items.q: Today's young graduates are having problems adjusting to the workplace. There are many ____________________ (reasons for / reasons by) this, but by far the most prevalent is the change in America's competitive values.

____________________ (In the record / For the record), these young people are referred to as Millennials . They are taught that competition is not as important as it once was, and the key is participating and working together.
On the playing field, for instance, every child gets a trophy for participating as a ____________________ (means by / means of) raising self-confidence.

Young adults have grown up with a ____________________ (need for / need by) immediate results. This mentality does not translate well in the workplace, where many projects need months and even years to come to fruition.
Millennials often have a ____________________ (lack for / lack of) the patience and long-term planning skills to see a project or task through to the end.
This can become a ____________________ (source of / source in) reduced productivity.
____________________ (For the same time / At the same time), this generation of workers expects constant positive feedback from bosses.
____________________ (In general / For general), teachers and parents are used to heaping praise for simple participation.
In the workplace, older employers have little ____________________ (interest on / interest in) constant praise; they just do not function in that way.

It will be interesting to see if, when these young graduates become bosses themselves, there will be a ____________________ (decrease of / decrease in) the amount of praise that is expected, and given, in the workplace.
My veterinarian told me that my cat is not just fat—he's ____________________.
The ____________________ is different in Japan than it is in the United States.
You're wearing that to the dance? But those pants are so ____________________!
Sam wants to ____________________ a career in accounting.
Mark would not ____________________ a word about what happened last weekend.
I really haven't spoken with Jeanne since we had that ____________________.
Don't wear that shirt—it has a ketchup____________________ on it.
A pleasant and positive ____________________ is key to happiness in the workplace.
The automobile accident was ____________________ for the two teenagers.
I'd rather that you didn't ____________________ anything about my hairstyle this time.
to be involved _____
to derive satisfaction _____
to reap the benefits _____
to reduce the risk _____
to suffer _____
to have a demand _____
to have _____
to affect _____
to be diagnosed _____
to engage in _____
Using Pesticides on Fruits and Vegetables ____________________
Athletes Share the Reasons for Their Success ____________________
What Causes Acid Rain ____________________
Leading Causes of Obesity in Children ____________________
My Top Ten Favorite Web Sites ____________________
The Role of Vitamin C in Preventing Illness ____________________
Why Sales of Newspapers Are Declining ____________________
Reality Shows on TV ____________________
Write about the effect that graduating from college has on a person's life. Use several cause-effect transition expressions.
